intro: Lindelofia stylosa var. pterocarpa, commonly known as the winged lindelofia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming during the dry season. Its unique fruit, which resembles a winged capsule, is adapted for wind dispersal, aiding in its propagation across open habitats. This species thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
